comments.body:
@escowles a few questions about this one:

- Do we want these indexed for display, search, or both?
- If for display, what is the desired display?  Underneath the subject headings?  Should they be links or not? If a 653 term is the same as a subject heading in the record, do we still want to display the 653 separately?
- Are there any specific example records that DSSG had in mind?

figgy.title: Arabic section titles are not appearing as Right To Left in Universal Viewer

comments.body:
https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/pull/5750 updates manifests as per the implementation proposal in the previous comment. However, UV only implemented the rtl direction feature for the metadata info pane, not for the leftPanel "Contents" iiif-tree-component.

Code references:

- the TreeView in the leftpanel module uses TreeNode for the elements of the table of contents https://github.com/UniversalViewer/universalviewer/blob/86f2cd47598ed2b2cef6b30fd3dc706b0c8b9807/src/content-handlers/iiif/modules/uv-contentleftpanel-module/TreeView.ts
- The TreeNode itself is defined in manifesto: https://github.com/IIIF-Commons/manifesto/blob/6e355e34c38b64b9cf9c366d6ff60006db341968/src/TreeNode.ts
  - the label is set in the constructor, making it much more difficult to override the behavior here, to the extent that it's either not actually possible or really not a good idea.
- Here's some code showing how it works in the metadata info pane: https://github.com/UniversalViewer/universalviewer.github.io/blob/85dac1a4274f53659ba136c2bcd7ce1ab8c9d908/vendor/uv/lib/iiif-metadata-component.js#L375-L382
- language direction configuration referenced in the UV ticket: https://github.com/UniversalViewer/universalviewer/blob/67ada49f6d866a51ab173d7166f6ddf04fffb471/src/content-handlers/iiif/extensions/uv-mediaelement-extension/options/en-GB.json#L50

Note that @tpendragon also tried just putting html as the manifest value, but that resulted in an error.

The proposed path forward is (not necessarily in this order):
* [ ] Work on UV upstream to implement the required feature, possibly in collaboration with someone in the UV community.
* [x] Migrate from webpacker to vite (https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/issues/5734)
* [ ] Update figgy to use the latest UV release, ensuring we carry over local customizations (see #5778)

However, this path forward is a bigger project than we had hoped and the work will need to undergo prioritization again.
New example developed during UV community call: https://codesandbox.io/s/uv-vite-example-9ie3rh

figgy.title: fixity dashboard load time still extremely slow
Redesign the preservation status indicators on the resource show page

comments.body:
Given that there may be several types of errors on a given fileset, that preserved filesets should display "preserved", and cards should remain the same size, here is a revision. The errors and warnings stack on top of each other below the thumbnail. They could potentially obscure the thumbnail if there are enough. I removed the color of the card outline that corresponds to the error or warning since they can be mixed.

One thing to note is that I'm assuming DLS is not notified of a fixity failure and that the user must contact DLS to resolve it. I think the easiest thing to do here is to allow the user to report it, sending a message with a unique identifier to a DLS queue so we can try to resolve the issue manually. Once it's reported, it displays "Reported" and is no longer actionable.

We will need to display the following error messages:

- Repairing Derivatives
- Repairing Local Fixity
- Repairing Cloud Fixity
- Derivatives Failed | Report
- Local Fixity Failed | Report
- Cloud Fixity Failed | Report

![filemanager-fixity5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/609368/236327234-d679073a-9156-43fd-a80b-818060def9f5.jpg)

comments.body:
examples:

https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/requests/99126230255306421?aeon=false&mfhd=22709114850006421

https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/requests/SCSB-12077423?aeon=false

https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/requests/99125410673606421?aeon=false&mfhd=22905775240006421

https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/requests/99126743805306421?aeon=false&mfhd=22954825980006421

https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/requests/99126743805306421?aeon=false&mfhd=22954825980006421

@kevinreiss if you think of another case can you please include it in this comment?

https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/requests/99125406567906421?aeon=false&mfhd=22909083010006421 in library use marquand recap

https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/requests/SCSB-9231592?aeon=false scsb in library use at marquand

https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/requests/SCSB-8953469?aeon=false scsb in library use firestone

https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/requests/SCSB-6768462?aeon=false scsb many in library use items

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/59637332/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/59637332)

Coverage: 95.306%. Remained the same when pulling **58a01e5a3c0182f8daab9568410d340448e204bd on 3512-requestsjs** into **478e049d8b6c503076ff8ca79e64d46ee2720bdb on main**.

I noticed one issue that I would classify as bug we may want to fix before releasing this, with an in process item on a multi-item form. Selecting only hte in process row does not activate the request button: 
https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/requests/998574693506421?aeon=false&mfhd=22579850750006421

4th item is in process.

A couple of other items that I might ticket if others agree. The E-delivery validation is a bit wonky still. 

If you select the row, then select e-delivery the button activates before you type a title. If you submit w/o a title it errors and forces yo to write in so it is not a major blocker: https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/requests/99122304923506421?aeon=false&mfhd=22511126440006421

For the fill in option it's the same behvior but the form doesn't highlight the missing title field you just get an error at the bottom of the page:
https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/requests/99110528583506421?aeon=false&mfhd=22732237860006421

Again I don't view these two as blockers for this general fix.

pdc_describe.title: Are we adding the right license.txt to the migrated objects?

comments.body: Per conversation on Slack just now, this is OK.  The "license.txt" file shown here is generated by DataSpace as part of the built-in DSpace "LicenseUtils" module, taking the language of the click-through license agreement in DataSpace and putting it into a flat text file that gets downloaded alongside the rest of the files in the bundle.  The license info in PDC Describe is recorded in the DataCite record.  We should keep this "license.txt" file that comes from DataSpace with the original object as part of the migration.
